RestaurantInfo.Name: PURPLE ZEBRA
RestaurantInfo.Address: THE LINQ HOTEL, 3545 S LAS VEGAS BLVD

Reviews.Author: Jesus
Reviews.Content: The inside look nice and clean. The workers where friendly and they had a big selection inside that showed what alcohol the slushies had. The cups and bottles they sell are really cool. They had sports design like football and baseball.They let you sample the flavors and i got the sour patron grand mariner. Fat Tuesday does put more alcohol on their slushies but i love the taste here. The flavor was the reason i chose to get their drink and i got a cool cup. They have cool bottles and a saxophone was really cool. I choose a simple one because i wanted to use it everyday and happy with it. If your looking for taste, come here. If you want something stronger, Fat tuesday is the place.

Reviews.Author: Joanna
Reviews.Content: Food: We got the peach and blue lemonade flavors. The peach was super good - highly highly recommend - it tastes like the peach ring candies! The blue lemonade was a hit with my friends. The alcohol content seems quite low, I could barely taste it. It tasted really good, very sweet and the bottle is also very cute and fun to carry around. I didn't particularly like the way they put layers of 2 flavors because after the beginning everything just starts to melt together and it combines.  *Pro tip: you can ask to try the flavors!  Price: The price of our medium sized leg was about $25 - the larger leg is $35 and there are small ones for individuals for about under $20. For the price, it's not worth it. It's the gimmick of holding a large leg full of alcoholic slushies which is why people buy it. For that size, you could probably buy a slurpee at 711 and add your own alcohol and it would be less than $10.  Service: The service was okay - we asked to try all of the flavors, but he only let us try 4 of them. Not only that but I went with 3 other boys and he only gave us one little cup for all of us to share?? Not good impression at all. Other than that, the guy was pretty chill and nice - I just don't know why he was being so cheap with us sampling - we were going to buy it anyway, we just wanted to know what flavors we'd want.  Ambiance: The ambiance is ok - has a circus kind of feel since its brightly lit with lots of colors. It gives off a willy wonka kind of vibe. It might be fun to sit and drink, but I think most people just take their legs to go.

Reviews.Author: Santana Ross
Reviews.Content: I loved the concept of being able to get alcoholic slurpees, because that is what it reminded me of. The cups are cute, but I have no idea what you would do with them when you're done with it. It is a nice souvenir, but I wouldn't take it home since I hate collecting junk. However, cute to have while you're in Vegas to have something cold to drink while walking around.   The cup I chose was 32 ounces and with the alcohol, it ended up being around $28.

Reviews.Author: Ariana
Reviews.Content: Think 7-11 slurpee.  That's basically what the concept of this place reminded me of. Except think slurpee with alcohol :) Although I honestly couldn't taste any alcohol. So Mehhhhh.   I was happy to try a variety of samples, definitely have to say peach was my favorite! My friend decided that she wanted to get one. Holy poop! I had no idea those cups were so dang expensive!! I really think its overpriced.   If you do decided to purchase one of these cups I recommend getting a small one. We got a medium size and not even half way done drinking this, we were over it.

Reviews.Author: Monique
Reviews.Content: STRONG SLUSHIES!! PERIOD. Overpriced? Sure, but then again..it's Vegas where everything is overpriced. I loved the variety of flavors and I was allowed to sample two flavors prior to purchasing. Good stuff on a blazing, hot, day in the desert!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I got a non alcoholic drink . I already had a drink earlier in the week so I decided I will go with non alcoholic.  I think the non alcoholic drink could be less sweeter.  I liked the fact that it's self serve. The lady who helped me ( don't remember her name) was really helpful. I liked that they had all sorts of unique cups here. I wanted the saxophone  but it was too big and 100oz.  I'm not going to finish that. I wished they had a smaller saxophone cup around a 30-50oz. I got the zebra hoof which is just as cool. Other than that, I would be back here. This time to try an alcoholic drink in a another unique cup.

Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: It's expensive/overpriced, but fun. You can sample as many of the adult slushie flavors as you like. And some are quite tasty. You pick out your container, and then get let in behind the fence to mix and match and fill your container. I got pretty creative with this and wound up with a most tasty and delightful frozen drink. There's also no -alcoholic flavors for the kiddos and non-drinkers. They also have a lunch card where you can earn a free refill. If nothing else, stop by and enjoy some free samples.

Reviews.Author: Donald
Reviews.Content: Come down and try the Zoo Guava Crush for sure... Make sure your ask for Sam Milkshake!!!

Reviews.Author: Cortney
Reviews.Content: Z  For Zebra...  Who doesn't love a great cocktail in a cute souvenir cup!  I enjoyed sampling varies daiquiri flavors without inconveniencing the  traditional bartender!   I highly recommend if your interested in creating new experiences!!!  I had a three flavor concoction and it was amazing! I'm a local and I will definitely return with my cute cup and stamp card!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: Everyone is super nice the shots are only 3 and it's a huge shot !!!! And they give you a free chaser as well so good !!!! Kevin and heather were really nice ! Will def come again :)

Reviews.Author: Kaylen
Reviews.Content: Go to Fat Tuesday!! During my stay here at The Linq, I decided to try this place out instead of making the trip over to Fat Tuesday. The drinks were over priced, and tbh, not strong at all. I got the $15 size with an extra shot and felt nothing!! Save your $$ and make the trip to Fat Tuesday.

Reviews.Author: Annette
Reviews.Content: Super Fun! This place is a cross between a self serve yogurt shop and a daiquiri bar. You even get sample cups to taste em all! And they had at least 15-20 flavors plus another 10 non alcoholic ones for the kiddos. I'm a sucker for booze filled Slurpees so this was a dream. My fave was the Fireball Whiskey. Mix it with the Peach for a Peach Cobbler or Piña Colada for a Horchata with a kick. Sounds odd but trust me... So delish. Add an extra shot of fireball and you are set. Skip the souvenir cup and it was $9 plus $2 for the extra shot. The nonalcoholic version is $5. We will be back!

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I love the slushy alcoholic drinks when I'm in Vegas and Purple Zebra has the best quality and flavors! This is our new go-to spot for slushy drinks~  Every bartender we met was very nice, friendly, and helpful.   The H2O Melon is a must-try!! By far the best flavored slushy I've tired. You can't even taste the alcohol  and it's even delicious with an extra shot!

Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: Omg..love this place. Love Samantha and the hot guy Jorge.  My favorite place on earth.

Reviews.Author: Fuzzy
Reviews.Content: Four stars for taste, but only one star for alcohol content.  Wifey has a foolproof alcohol indicator (she turns red), but even drinking 24oz of this stuff had no effect.   The drinks were definitely tasty and it's a fun concept. But next time we're in Vegas we'll probably try Fat Tuesday, based on the reviews we've seen here.

Reviews.Author: Rj
Reviews.Content: Fun way to buy your alcoholic slushee drinks! Its the version of frozen yogurt but ones that get you buzzed.  Purple Zebra is an experience. You buy the container you want your slushee in and then you get to choose on which flavors you like. When you enter the pouring zone, you also get a chance to sample different flavors.  The staff is very helpful and friendly. The steps are on the wall. It is pretty entertaining to look t he decor inside as well.  Thanks for the samples and the tasty icy beverages!

Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: This place is incredible!!! I love buying yard long drinks on the strip but now you can customize the cup that it comes in!! Even better that they have non-alcoholic options. Everything from zebra print, saxophones, twisted cups, footballs, even just the regular ones. One of the new additions to The Linq and it was so cool!

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Cute cups and good concept but my cup began leaking about a quarter of the way through the drink. It dripped down my legs and got me all sticky and I couldn't properly enjoy it. Close to 30 oz later and I didn't feel a thing. They tasted good but not worth it at all; the alcohol content is practically nonexistent.

Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: Sometimes as a local, you have to go a little  tourist  to remind yourself of the fun this city can be.  A friend and I stopped in here after work during our visit to the Linq shopping area.  The place is set up like a giant candy store.  Actually, parts of it ARE an actual candy store.  There are plenty of little candies and such that go along with the rows of goofy, oversidzed glasses.  The back wall, however, is the main draw.  An entire wall devoted to drinks.  But here's the catch.  One half is alcoholic.  The other half is not.  So it's basically an all ages Icee/Slurpee stand.  And once you buy your selected cup (they do give discounts and punch cards to locals), you are allowed to step inside the gated area.  Now here's the kicker: They hand you a small collection of tiny cups to sample the various flavors, which I appreciated.  Nothing like spending a small fortune on one of those ridiculous drinks only to find that it tastes like Windex.  These tend to be more flavorful, despite the quantities of booze involved.  And you can even mix and match, so you can create your own Frankendrink.  So I friend and I walked out, giant zebra hooves in hand, and proceeded to have the rest of the night's adventure.  The staff was friendly, and the process was unobtrusive and easy, so it just made our stopover fun.  I've kept my hoof for the next time I decide to make my rounds over to the Purple Zebra.  I can see taking my vacationing friends to the place.

Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: I think the place is five stars because the fact that they have soo many yummy flavors to choose from and the its for a reasonable price i think i paid like low $30s. Not bad. Bring your friends

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: Tourist paradise. Sometimes you just need an alcoholic slush in a cheesy cup. Prices are expensive, but what do you expect for this location.   Worth a visits and they have lots of fun drink cups to choose from.

Reviews.Author: Hayley
Reviews.Content: We always take friends and family here when they come to visit us! More expenaive than Fat Tuesday but FAR BETTER QUALITY ALCOHOL. My favorite is the Black Cherry Rum one. If you are a local invest in one of the two flavor twisty cups and make sure to get a punch card!! It is reusabke, cheaper for your guests, and you get your 5th refill for free!!

Reviews.Author: Rishonda
Reviews.Content: It's not okay that I've been a frequent customer and the worker working decided to hold the door shut at 11:56pm to signal that their closed. You close at midnight! That's not okay and put a bad taste in my mouth for a place I used to love.

Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: There is a reason the larger version of this place closed. It is an erroneously labeled slurpee station that is highly overpriced and sorely lacks the alcohol of its competitors. Bartender was nice but that is about the only pro I see for this place. If you want to compete with Fat Tuesdays compete. Don't skimp on the alcohol. This is Vegas you know. I sense a closure very soon.

Reviews.Author: Nelson
Reviews.Content: YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(124/365)  Safari of Slushies   Cool concept and all, but.....nope  Lots of flavors(alcoholic and non-alcoholic) to choose from, but for me, I can't get past that nasty artificial taste..blech!  Prices here for the drink containers are just RE-DICK!!!! The containers come in all kinds of shapes, sizes, and designs, but hey, you're on the Strip, remember?  Nutella fans, you can purchase the bucket here. They have a section of  Hash House A Go-Go  sized sweets back in the corner. Oh, the bucket is only 50 buckeroonis...  With other spots like La Salsa Cantina and Fat Tuesdays, I wonder if the Purple Zebra will be able to survive extinction. ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  2.5

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas has large slushie drinks everywhere. But this place (like everywhere here) makes it an experience.  You pick out your glass first and they have a ton to choose from. Once you buy (my friends bought me a 100 oz since I'm getting married soon... Thanks...) you get to go in the back where they have 20+ flavors and fill up what you just purchased. Not only that but you get unlimited free samples (I filled myself up almost just doing this). Some were horrible and some were great and some only good if you mixed them.  My friends (thanks again) also bought liquor shots for me and knowing I was the bachelor she was not conservative with her pours.  The customer service was great. She was friendly and even though only two of us bought drinks, she let all five in our group back for samples so that was cool.  I will say (thank god) the drinks are fairly weak because I was okay (read not sick or hungover) after almost (I couldn't finish) 100 oz of slushie and she DID pour extra shots in it.   Fun experience though for reasonable money. Also a good way to spend a hot day hanging out.

Reviews.Author: Keiara
Reviews.Content: Spiffy place, definitely a social setting. I enjoyed the concept of the bar not to mention the staff especially Taylar who was extremely helpful and informative. Taylar made the experience amazing keeping a smile on her face throughout the entire time. I do think the drinks could be a little stronger, I could barely taste the alcohol. Overall it was a cool experience.

Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: I've been in here a few times and never had a problem, other than its expensive. Well, I went in tonight and got my usual, the peach flavor and the southern sinner. The southern sinner tasted like pure vodka. And I'm sure I'm the only one down on the strip to complain, but it was disgusting. What were they willing to do to help? Let me pour it out and pay the same price I just did. The ONLY thing that made this right was the manager replying to this original post and fixing the situation and apologizing for the situation and replacing the drink. So to her, Thank you.

Reviews.Author: Natalie
Reviews.Content: I truly do not understand how this place can have any *Four Star  reviews.  Upon my visit (not greeted) not that it matters but I would have guessed the girl at the cashier who was perfectly able to see us walk in would offer a friendly hello. On several occasions where my boyfriend and I asked her questions she would respond very little and very sarcastic. We almost left if it wasn't for the guys working at the  flavor dispenser who kindly offered us some samples and answered our questions.  Would I come here again? No. Lowest price cup is $15 and its very simply printed with different colors and a zebra.  The drinks are very tasty but very non-alcoholic even if there is alcohol in it. They also charge more for a tube shot of patron or tequia.  I would recommend trying Fat Tuesday. Or heading over to Old DownTown Las Vegas for the bar called  The D

Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Lame....all of the containers are designed for women.  Not much candy as advertised.  Walked out.

Reviews.Author: Ziwei
Reviews.Content: I came here instead of Fat Tuesday because I was staying at the Flamingo and Purple Zebra was closer.  I regret being lazy like that.  The slushies here are WAY overpriced.  Non-alcoholic slushies start at around $12 and alcoholic slushies start at $20 for the small plastic cups that are $9 at Fat Tuesday's.  If you're going to get alcoholic slushies here, I highly recommend adding an extra shot or two because there's so little alcohol content in them - and that's saying a lot coming from a small little Asian girl who can get drunk on almost nothing.  Literally, they're just like regular slushies.  Also, the flavors were mediocre, nothing special, and I thought they were all a bit too sweet.  I did like how you get to serve yourself and can mix and sample all of the different flavors.  The guys who worked there were super nice too.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: The drinks were amazing and the customer service was great. They let me taste everything before I purchased. I love this place down at Linq!

Reviews.Author: Sydney
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited Purple Zebra in The Linq, and we loved the creative and colorful vibes of the store. We had a hard time deciding which  vessel  we wanted for our refreshments because they had a huge selection!   After we went to go buy the vessel to fill them up, one of the employees said very bluntly to my friend,  Your vessel costs 6 more dollars, so you HAVE to go pay for that. The other employee messed up.  We were taken aback by the employee's tone. The employee who messed up didn't even apologize for her mistake.   When I went to go fill up my vessel, the liquid spewed all over my shoes because the lever was sticky and difficult to maneuver.   The nice thing about the Purple Zebra is that they discount your refreshment if you bring back the same vessel with the punch card.

Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: Really cool concept. The staff was very welcoming, funny, and helpful. I got the leg cup, if that's the appropriate term. I got a lot of people interested in where I got it. The drinks are yummy but as previously mentioned, not strong. I couldn't finish my drink even sharing it with my boyfriend. I don't even know if we got about half way through. We ended up pouring our own Patron in an mixing all our flavors together. It was still delicious.   My favorite was the orange one (can't remember the name). And the leg cup makes a damn cool coin holder (which was the main reason we bought the thing lol).  Overall, it's a really cool store that will get you some attention, but I don't see myself getting it again. Though, the price wasn't too bad for their stuff.   They also are affiliated with Total Rewards so make sure you swipe! Unfortunately, their system wasn't fully set up so we weren't able to redeem and buy with points, but we did add points for the purchase.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: This place is open!!! My niece and I got the saxophone and nephew got the champagne glass. We each got extra shots and it was $130 for all three. Refills are 20% off. Great souvenir plus it's nice to walk around with your cup around your neck.

Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: You have to look at this place like a novelty and experience if you are going to enjoy your visit. What they are doing is pretty cool. There is a huge variety of cups with different sizes and prices. Then you begin sampling a large variety of frozen drinks (there are non-alcoholic options too). You can choose more than one flavor and mix them or choose one favorite. The only reason I'm not more of a fan is the price. Food is my splurge, but geez, this was over the top even for the strip. Still, it'd be fun for tourists as a one time splurge, but I can't imagine this as a repeat stop.

Reviews.Author: Darla
Reviews.Content: Inside the Linq everyone stops at this very kewl icee bar! Pick a flavor and a size and its the best drink bar in the house. Looking forward to having another drink here. I definitly would recommend checking this place out. Nice and clean and friendl employees...

Reviews.Author: Cara
Reviews.Content: Adam was the best it was my best friends birthday and cinco de mayo and he made our experience really fun and exciting!

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: They have a HUGE selection of cups and different types of drinks. It's a really nice place and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: This place is super fun! 18 delicious flavors and two for one deals on Tuesdays! They have a frequent drinker card to earn free refills and they have extra shots available as well. It's a neat atmosphere and everyone there is friendly!

Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: I was here 1week ago EDC weekend. It was busy because they are giving away free shots. Went inside the store and no one even welcome us. The manager Ashley Mazone is standing In front of the store looking at us and she didn't even say welcome or helped us. I just found out she's the manager because of her name tag but she doesn't look like one. We got free samples of daiquiris and it's weak! Fat Tuesday is way better!!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Super cute concept: like a self-serve yogurt place for adults! I thought it was really great that they pass out free samples.   Prices are a bit insane, but that's what I would expect on the Strip. You cannot taste the alcohol in the drinks at all, and I'm doubtful they include much. Would much prefer you buy a shot and then add the mixes on top (like Coyote Ugly now does at NY NY). I shouldn't have to buy an additional shot.   I would come back because this was kinda a fun thing to do with friends, and the decor and experience was fun.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: Really cool place! The staff is very friendly! The drinks are awesome. You can mix and match as many flavors as you like. The only reason I am not giving it the fifth star is because I think the drinks could be stronger, but you do have the option to add an extra shot (or however many you want) for an additional charge.

Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! I stopped in with the wife while on the strip and I was very glad that I did.   As you can see on the wall, there is a non-alcohol side, and then the alcohol side. Of course, you wanna go to the alcoholic side, as you pay the same amount either way. We ended up doing the buy 2 for half price deal, and we picked up a couple extra shots to put in as the slushee's aren't terribly strong.  My favorites? The patron margarita, blue curacao, and the cherry.

Reviews.Author: Patrice
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this store. The cute cups, the variety of liquor choices and most of all the candy. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great place for tourist.

Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: Good concept. They do have a lot to choose from both with and with out alcohol. Lots of cup options too. You buy the cup of your choice price is based on wether it has alcohol or not. Although you can't taste the alcohol at all. I wish you could add shots. Cool looking little spot I'm sure it will do well on the strip. Not much for candy but then they're not really a candy store anyway.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Disappointed to come from Vegas with my specialty cup and they no longer have the stamp passes :( Lady said they were closing so they didn't get any more...two thumbs down

Reviews.Author: Janice
Reviews.Content: Can't believe this replaced Fat Tuesday, what a disappointment. Very little flavor in most of the samples I tried, settled on the margarita since it had the most flavor. Half way through it somehow lost most of it and never tasted any alcohol. Guess the bartender forgot to mention any extra shots that might be added, since he was so busy trying to impress the 2 younger females and couldn't be bothered with my SIL and I. Guess that's why there weren't many people bothering to stop and patronize the place. When it closes, and I'm sure it will, please bring back Fat Tuesday.

Reviews.Author: Samuel
Reviews.Content: I am a Vegas local. The Purple Zebra is a haven for tourists. They have a large selection of glasses and containers, and an equally large selection of flavors. I wanted to go down to the Linq for the first time, and do the  touristy  thing.   I opted for a medium sized beer bottle shaped container. As expected, the prices were a bit outrageous. 35 dollars for myself and my wife, who got a small cupcake container and the non-alcoholic option.  I ended up getting a strawberry flavored drink, and mixed it with the mojito flavor. Not bad, really sweet, and not strong.   The pros- neat idea, lots of flavors, the female employees wear this tu-tu uniform, and you can see half of their back sides.   The cons- expensive, did not even get a buzz, gave up drinking after a good 20oz because it was too sweet, and not enough alcohol, you look like a tourist.   It was worth a try, but not the type of place that I would try again. I would rather go to Fat Tuesdays next door, and save some money, and get a buzz.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Drinks taste good but very little booze. I won't go here again. You should try the drinks in front of Paris. Those are strong

Reviews.Author: Tunara
Reviews.Content: This place was so cute and the drinks are really good!! Purple Zebra is 10 times better than Wet Willies and Fat Tuesday's (who's drinks are way too sweet). Love the cute cups!!

Reviews.Author: Janel
Reviews.Content: I see it as a hybrid of 7-11 wonderland and a Willy Wonka slush fest. I was early for my show, so I said sure. Why not, lets give it a whirl. I walked in enticed by the color and fun and excitement this place exudes. It's ambiance and servicescape is a mimic of Sugar Factory and M&M world.   They have a variety of tumblers to choose from. I chose a Zebra print tumbler. I felt it was less like a yard stick (because yardsticks are more likely to be used to hold your loose change or be thrown away), and served more of a purpose in the long term. So, you buy the tumbler and if you want the alcoholic beverage it will total $20 (which they said a tumbler will contain 3 shots in itself). Without the alcohol and just a regular flavored slushie, it would be $16, and then refills with the container is $12.   You also get a stamp card in which you get the 5th refill for free. At least they have a nice incentive there for you to go back.  FOR THE OUT-OF-TOWNERS: If you are looking to try your first yardstick or first slush experience. I would recommend this place. It's more interactive, and customer driven. Think the 7-11 experience where you pick what flavors and the possiblities are endless, and there are free samples to try in case you're unsure. It's all just a world of choices, and if you're looking to have fun with it. Try it. This place was made for you.   If you brought kids with you, of course, they would have fun little cups for kids, and non alcoholic slushies so you and your kids can brain freeze together!  Recommended flavors:  TASTE LIKE HEAVEN - for all you Fireball Whiskey lovers.  MON CHERRY - goes good with Taste Like Heaven PEACHY PASSION - (i think thats what it's called) It has peach and I love me some peach.

Reviews.Author: Trisa
Reviews.Content: Love this place!! Purple Zebra is a spot to get chilled adult drinks in funky containers!! We had to try every flavor, and our server was extra sweet and helpful! We bought a couple of Jell-O shots and filled zebra-printed chillers with the yummy Peach flavored frozen concoction! A must see if you're near the Linq in Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I wish I could honestly get my money back spend $56 on a 100 oz drink that I swear had no alchohol in it. Most expensive slushie I have ever bought!!

Reviews.Author: Leila
Reviews.Content: Samantha rocks!  Fun place to take shots, I love the crazy colors here, its like an adult smoothie eutopia;)

Reviews.Author: Risya
Reviews.Content: You pick a cup and you fill it up with your favorite alcoholic or non-alcoholic frozen beverage!  What more is there to say?!  You can mix them and the place is just fun! The staff is very friendly, just FYI though, it is a bit pricey.   They do let you sample the flavors as long as you have ID

Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: This place tricks you with the large variety of  alcoholic  frozen mixes, but do not waste your time and money!!! Go to Fat Tuesday if you want a real frozen alcoholic beverage.   Pros: -Nice decor.  -Great variety of souvenir cups to choose from. -Very Clean. -Nice selection of frozen mixes.  And it stops right there!  Cons: -There is absolutely no alcohol in the frozen mixes. They taste JUST like the non-alcoholic mixes on the other side of the wall. -They bring your extra shot to you. You never see the bottle!!!! -The workers were so busy having a conversation amongst themselves that we had to wait around for service.  When you enter the store there's a wall full of shelves with souvenir cups. First you pick a cup and pay before you're directed to the wall of frozen mixes. I purchased the champagne bottle souvenir cup and decided to pay for 2 additional shots of grey goose. Once they checked my receipt I was allowed into the area to sample & pour my desired mix. Cool. Now once I had my cup full one of the workers checked to see which shot I ordered and went to the back to retrieve it. He came back with a test tube full of clear liquid which I was to beeline was  grey goose. Now this is when I became leery. Why aren't the bottles of liquor sitting on a shelf so customers can see you pouring their requested brand?! Fishy! After sipping a good portion of my drink I noticed that it was really sugary and I didn't taste a bit liquor, even with the 2 shots of  vodka . Halfway through I just trashed it and walked over to Fat Tuesday inside The Quad. I would not waste another $35 on this place when I only paid $12 at Fat Tuesday with only 1 extra shot and had a nice buzz within 10mins!

Reviews.Author: Yoshi
Reviews.Content: The girl at the counter wasn't the brightest, but the guy who helped us choose flavors and fill the giant containers was great! Beverage selection was good for both alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks.  It's a little pricey, but for a unique souvenir and 60 ounces of frozen deliciousness, it's definitely worth it. I combined the peach Bellini with the mod-cherry. Yummy!!

Reviews.Author: De'Mesha
Reviews.Content: Pick a Cup and fill up....you can taste test and get extra shots added. I hit this place each time I passed it which was like 6 times. They even have punch cards! I like the decor and the concept plenty of choices to mix up and once you find your mix it will be your get drunk go-to for sure! Mine was Guava, Top Shelf Margarita and the one with the Fireball in it!

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Very PURPLE décor / zebras  good customer service  get to try free samples of the mixed drinks  they have non-alcoholic / alcoholic mixes  pretty tasty

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Cool concept. Pretty store, it attracts people. Big store. BUT the employee there was kind of rude. The fun music randomly stopped and it was dead quiet. This place was overpriced. It was really hot and we wanted something to give us a buzz & be yummy at the same time. You do get to taste and sample. They had some bomb flavors.   We didn't even get a buzz. And we paid like 35 bucks for our large souvenir cup and slushie mix. Super lame. This place is a trap. It's cheaper to buy a cool cup, a 7-11 slushie, & your own alcohol. Waste of money. No wonder this place was empty dead...

Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: The shop was really cool looking and picking out your drink was fun but you get 0 bang for your buck. We drank over 30oz of there alcoholic slushies and barely got a buzz. It was just a lot of sugar and priced at about $30. If your looking to do some drinking don't stop here.

Reviews.Author: Leilani Laisa
Reviews.Content: I've been here before and I took my sister who has never been because I had a great experience here before.  This place is located at the LINQ so you'll have to walk down the shopping area to see it.  The place is huge and colorful and has a lot of different cups.  You pick your cup and proceed to the alcohol slushy machines.  There are about twenty different flavors, some weird like a coffee one.  They have sample cups which is cool and also a menu that shows different combinations of flavors as a suggestion.  The floor was real sticky but there was a girl there mopping.   The cashier was slow and unfriendly and looked bored.  We all get bored at work but she could try to look a little less irritated.  We purchased extra shots for funsies.  They have a refill card and you can go back and refill for a lesser price and you get a free one on the 3rd or 4th refill, I don't remember.  There were flies inside which were annoying. Two stars off for flies and unfriendly cashier.  The girl mopping was nice, there were a large variety of cups/flavors, store was fun.  I will come back but if it is in the same state I probably won't. You should still try it once.

Reviews.Author: Cornelius
Reviews.Content: So....second round of being in Vegas within a few months and there was no way I could be here visiting and do not stop by the Purple Zebra. Drinks, Drinks, Drinks!!!  Well needed and most importantly well needed. It wasn't packed in the building so the young lady was able to fully help us which was great.  I actually remember her from the last visit and she was just as nice as she was then.  You can never go wrong with the Purple Zebra.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Overpriced as shit; but it's Vegas, so suck it up (hypocrite here, I walked!). It's a freaking buffet of diabolical alcoholic slushies combining fruity deliciousness with fire water components, which will inevitably grasp out-of town future Strip stumblers by their little necks and lead them down what can only be described as the  Walk of Shame .  I'd describe it as go big or go home; some original slushie transportation devices (w/drink) can range well over $50. While alcoholic slushies aren't typically my bag, I think they're original take on a slushie-eria will keep even the manliest Jersey Shore-Vegas transplant douche-bags sucking drink out of tiny little straws til their unavoidable mind-numbing brain freeze assaults their appalling blow-outs.

Reviews.Author: Tamarah
Reviews.Content: Pros: Cute zebra outfits on the female staff members Variety of large unique cups to choose from (Zebra legs, saxophones, fishnet stocking lady leg etc) Colorful decor   Cons: You're pretty much paying $20+ for a cool cup.  Do not expect to feel a buzz at all. If you want a buzz/feel like you drank some alcohol, I recommend Fat Tuesday instead or just go to a regular bar.   The most you will feel is full and you might get a headache because it is loaded with sugar.   Cool concept, but I do feel like I payed $25 for a sinus headache and a cool cup.

Reviews.Author: nina
Reviews.Content: Just spent $30 on a drink and the staff was rude and not helpful. They acted like we were bothering them. Go to fat Tuesdays this place is a total rip off

Reviews.Author: Karo
Reviews.Content: This place was really cool, but over priced. We found some of the same items without the purple zebra trademark on them at Walgreens. Unfortunately, we didn't know this prior to making purchases. They have almost every flavor daiquiri you could think of, and really cool souvenir containers. My favorite one was the lady's leg with the stiletto shoe, it was well over $50 with the beverage included which was more than what I wanted to pay. I ended up getting a thermos totaling around $32 and I purchased a $3 bud light for one of my friends.   Definitely a fun spot to visit ( for the sake of saying you were there ), but there are a few better options a little further down the strip.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: Really fun place! Had a great experience ! Rosie helped us with everything we needed! The drinks were tasty and very refreshing in such a hot weather! Definitely coming back next time we are in town! Best slushies in town!

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have been so excited to go to this place because it looks like a fun atmosphere. So saturday night around 10 we decided to finally give it a shot. I was highly disappointed in the customer service we received. I understand it was a saturday night but there was only about 3 other customers in the store. We did not get greeted, and there was 3 girls buy the cash wrap just carrying a personal conversation. I wanted to ask for help but decided to just figure it out on my own. When we chose our cup and went to pay, the 3 girls still kept talking and we waited about 15 sec before they finally stopped their conversation and rang us up. I must say the drinks did taste amazing but it sucks my experience was poor due to the lack of customer service. This place has great potentiAl but apparently poor management. Please fix

Reviews.Author: Esperanza
Reviews.Content: Went down to purple zebra on New Years 2016 and it was closed down. Does any one know what happened to it ?

Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: Super cute store and concept.  The guys working the fountain area were very friendly and helpful.  It was fun picking a cup and flavor.  However, the gnats or  fruit flies,  as the employees called them, were way out of control.  I can understand it might happen something because it is a sticky/sweet area due to the slushies' spilling, but still!  It was kind of a turn off and semi gross.  I gave it three stars because if they could fix that I would say to definitely go!

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: We stumbled on this gem when looking for the Linq. It's a cute store, the staff is very friendly and helpful, they know the products well. I don't like frozen drinks, alcoholic or non alcoholic. I like my drinks over ice. So I didn't buy anything. I don't want to use the word pushy but the girls were very all over you wanting to know if you want to buy something. I think it's called suggestive selling. I'm sure they have performance goals to meet. Sweet girls but all they have are slushie drinks and I don't care for slushie type drinks. I would still check out their merchandise and candy.

Reviews.Author: Kaisha
Reviews.Content: Purple Zebra is basically an overpriced tchotchke shop in the front and a boozy slurpee bar in the back. We only stopped in here on the way to the High Roller because one of our group decided that she needed a bottle in the shape of a zebra hoof. She got it and continues to treasure it so mission accomplished there.   The cups and stuff up front are way more expensive than I'd personally be comfortable paying however the selection of various receptacles for various liquids is pretty big is there are a lot of cute and unique ones available.   Along the back wall is a line of probably about 20 slurpee spigots in various flavors all of which are boozetastic. The cashier gave us some little sample cups so we were able to try quite a few and all of them were very yummy but there's a catch to boozy slurpees that you might not think of.  Brain Freeze. Like immediately. Even from those little sample sizes.  I'm sure there's some science that can explain why this brain freeze is so much more horrible and immediate than regular brain freeze but I don't know it.  Good luck with your Booze Freeze!

Reviews.Author: Tillifinney
Reviews.Content: If you're in Vegas for a few days and want some frozen alcohol to walk around with, definitely visit Purple Zebra on your first day. The initial price is a bit of a shock, but after you purchase a cup and finish your first drink all your refills ate 30% off. They also give you a punch card so your fifth cup-full is free! I think this is a way better value than other places nearby with the same offerings, but make sure you take advantage of the taster cups so you can get the most bang for your buck! Some of the flavors taste really good, but the alcohol content is much lower than some of the others.  Great concept, super fun, and the tiny buzz isn't bad either.

Reviews.Author: Doesn't Matter
Reviews.Content: We loved this place!!! The souvenir cups are so different and cute. We had a great time sampling all the different flavors and mixing them to make our own drinks! The girl at the counter was spunky and fun!

Reviews.Author: Ranae
Reviews.Content: I stopped in here with friends, and we were all greeted immediately upon entering, handed a menu and offered samples. We are locals and expected to pay $$ for a fun fru-fru drink. I was pleasantly surprised that I could get a perfectly sized container, with adult beverage for $15. I was even more pleasantly surprised that we were each given several sampler cups to try out different flavors, and the staff even showed us some good combinations of different drinks.   The three of us left happy, fun drink in hand (I loved the cherry mixed with margarita)..perfect for Cinco de Mayo. I also love that they offer a punch card rewards system, and offer 30% off refills. As a local who frequently has guests in town, I will definitely be taking advantage of this.   After checking in on Yelp, I noticed the poor reviews and all three of us were legitimately shocked at the 1 star ratings after having such a great experience.

Reviews.Author: Omar
Reviews.Content: best place ever,,, free samples and they dont care how much you smaple.. get a small cup, geta big cup, its worth the money, plus you can come back for a refil and get discount.. but you get a good  buzz just trying everything... and then you still have your cup.. best place ever!!!!!! the workers are awesome.. the ppl complaining are the ones who are anti-social ,,, the girls there are freeking awesome...

Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: One of the first tenants to open in The Linq entertainment center on the Las Vegas Strip.  A unique, self-serve daquiri bar where you can mix your own drinks with a variety of slushes and other ingredients.  You can also make your drink non-alcoholic, if you are so inclined.  This bar is like a self-serve frozen yogurt restaurant, only with liquor.  The decor is deliciously funky, to say the least.  I was greeted by two scantily clad waitresses who passed out free samples.  I went inside and made my own strawberry daquiri.  Yum!   I also decided to get a plain cup, although there are a number of novelty cups available.  Not a bad place, and I think I will be back to make another concoction!

Reviews.Author: Marco
Reviews.Content: I decided to check this spot out after seeing some funky shaped containers that were filled with alcohol. The presentation of the store was really cool and looked very inviting. The staff seemed young (at least 21). What makes me give this place such a low rating is how the staff handled multiple customers. There was no organization or communication. I had purchased extra shots for my drink and the associate that brought me into the gates to fill my container was overwhelmed by so many people trying to get in (well they pretty much walked in themselves).  After notifying the associate that I was missing my shots, she then helped out another group and I was left there looking like an idiot. I then went to another associate and asked when and where I would get my shots. Finally the second associate came and filled my drink with the shots. Next thing I know the first associate is filling my drink with more shots as I am asking for the giant straw that wasn't in my drink. I end up paying for another 3 shots. Aside from the miscommunication and crowd control of the staff, the drink itself was pretty good. I know it's a brand new spot and there is room for improvement. I guess I'll just stick to Fat Tuesday for a few more months. Until next time :)  Tl;dr poor communication. Long wait.

Reviews.Author: Brittney
Reviews.Content: wish I'd read the reviews ...  Ugh. I was so excited to have my friends try this place because I loved the concept of a candy store with a self serve daiquiri bar! i take full responsibility for this disappointment. I'm drawn to shiny, colorful, kitschy places and with all the cute zebras on the walls and ceiling and the many different drink vessels like cupcakes and footballs and zebra hooves, I was sold.   step 1: is to choose your vessel. my friend and I all bought different colored zebra hooves that came to about $23 each for the cup and the drink.  step 2: go to the register to pay. the time we went there was a promotion going on that with the second and third refill, they'd take a percentage off and the fourth refill would be free. psshh...no one used this in our group.  step 3: filling your vessel. you show the zebra print-clad hostess who lets 6 or less people at a time inside the gate where the machines are.  there are sample cups and many different flavors including a non alcoholic section for the kids.  the entire concept is genius! too bad the drinks were a total let down. for goodness sake, I mixed the alleged  Top Shelf Margarita  with another flavor composed mostly of Patron. I didn't get one buzz! neither did the people I was with. So I introduced them to Fat Tuesday's and showed them what a real daquiri tasted like.

Reviews.Author: Mary Rose
Reviews.Content: THEY SURE KNOW HOW TO CATCH SOMEONE'S EYE!  While walking down the Linq, I spotted The Purple Zebra! No... the actual PURPLE ZEBRA from the opening of the door. Oh, and they were also handing out free non-alcoholic beverage samples. =)   This is such a cute/cool place to bring/take tourists to! It reminds me of an UPGRADED FAT TUESDAYS! I got to try the pina colada (non-alcoholic of course), and it was wonderful. It'll definitely be a hit this summer, that's for sure!  In addition to the daiquiri bar, they have cool trinkets and candy!! So, here you go SWEET TOOTHS!  I will be back to try an alcoholic daiquiri though... SOON AND VERY SOON... Lol.   Hooray for Daiquiri Bars!

Reviews.Author: Jeggicah
Reviews.Content: Came here last year and loved it. The girl explained everything and filled up on Any sample. I was pretty smashed And was excited to try it out again when I came into town this week. First off its horribly overpriced. I mean yea I get to walk around with a zebra leg but sheesh I should at least get buzzed. Both my hubby and I got different drinks one vodka based and the other was rum. I got an extra shot just as I had last time for both drinks too. $65 later-  NOT buzzed AT ALL?! We both felt full like we had a giant smoothie, what a ripoff!  And lastly, the service was definitely not the same. Girls there tonight were lack luster in explaining anything to customers and basically seemed annoyed to be there. Whatever. Too many negatives for me to ever make a reappearance! So I will be returning to Fat Tuesdays b/c they seem to have it down on the alcohol ratio and not force you to buy a bunch of shots to get some kind of numbness. . Deuces!

Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: Super cute place for slushy drinks. I loved the blueberry lemonade one. I almost got my punch card filled too, almost.

Reviews.Author: Muffin
Reviews.Content: I went inside this store cause it looked like another cute colorful store and instead of selling candy, they sold drinks. How awesome...yah right. The staff inside were unhelpful and had completely ignored me and two friends of mine.   As soon as we walked in, I noticed a lady worker was handing out this tiny booklet that had a list of drink flavors to a couple in front of us. As I took 2 steps toward her to get one she turned around and walked another direction. So we just continued along and noticed a bunch of workers standing behind the rail where the store has a variety of drink flavors. I noticed a different couple trying several samples of the flavors. I stood and waited and not a single worker had asked if any of us would like to try a sample. They just stood around and talked with each other. (Mind you...The store was pretty empty. There were only about 10 people total.) So after a few minutes of waiting to see if they had any customer service skills, I asked one of the lady worker if I could see the tiny booklet with fun flavors written on it. She had no clue what I was talking about so she had to ask another worker (gentleman) and he had to ask a different lady worker to get me the booklet.  Are these people for real?!? Just talk to the customers (me!) about the flavors the store offers!! Sell me something.  I was there to buy a cup and put a yummy drink in it. Did they talk to me?!? NO! I was handed the stupid booklet and was still not asked if I would like to try anything. After the couple finished the samples and left (without buying anything) I stood around AGAIN to see if the worker (gentleman) would ask me if I would like a sample. (Mind you again....There was NO ONE around except me! Well my friends too but they were telling me to leave since we got no friendly worker to help us.) Getting annoyed by now I finally said that I would like to try the strawberry  something  (forgot the full name) and was given the tiniest sample in the world. It was probably one drop of the drink.  I noticed the couple before me getting their tiny sample cup filled to the top.  I was not asked if I liked the flavors or if I was interested in getting a cup....nope.  It was tasty and sugary but not a lot of alcohol.  I walked around and some of the prices were not labeled...well at least not the cup that I liked. I saw the prices for the other cups. I turned to ask any worker the price and suddenly there was no worker to be found who could assist me...  So in the end...I just walked out without buying anything.  Oh wells!

Reviews.Author: Alejandra
Reviews.Content: Searching for a Fat Tuesdays led us to discover this little gem.  Great decor, HUGE selection of cups at reasonable touristy prices, and a wide selection of tasty mixes. Some drinks tasted like that had more alcohol than others, but you can take your pick and mix.  Recommend to all you crazy, thirsty tourists.
